column4: Hi, does anyone else have issues with the Alsa HDA ATI SB (Alsa Mixer) being very quiet when volume is 100%?
kill $(lsof -t /dev/dsp* /dev/audio* /dev/mixer* /dev/snd/*) && sudo modprobe -r snd_hda_intel && sudo modprobe snd-hda-intel model=auto
we've already fixed it upstream in hg.
please don't query me.
depends if it resolves your issue.  That test is temporary (works until next modprobe -r).
did you execute the precise command I gave you (copy & paste)?
then log out of gnome, log into a console (ctrl+alt+F1), then execute the command.
please read http://www.linux-sound.info/alsa/index.php?task=support and tell me the URL of the paste generated by the script linked from that page.
The url? http://www.linux-sound.info/alsa/scripts/output.txt
no.  Download the alsa-info.sh script, execute it with ``bash ./alsa-info.sh'', then tell me the url that the script generated.
I'm waiting on my git tree.  I'm connected via a 56kbps dialup; it take a minute.
are you passing model=ref ?
hmm.  Ok, use model=ref instead and see if that resolves it.
which Dell is it?
anything more specific, like a model/revision # ?
I'm well aware.  :)
ok, quiet refers to speakers or headphones?
ok, and you have a 9200, correct?
we could probably special-case that codec revision
not the model of your laptop.  The model of your Sigmatel HDA codec.
we disable it, because we handle updates separately.
what is the proper method?
wait for it to appear in $release-security
